content:
Rhythm Central on Main St, that sounds like a great lead!

It's always a good idea to do your research and ask around before choosing a music shop for guitar servicing. Since your friend mentioned Rhythm Central, it's likely they have a good reputation in your community.

Before you call them, you might want to prepare a few questions to ask:

* What types of guitar servicing do they offer (e.g., setup, fretwork, electronics repair)?
* What's their average turnaround time for servicing?
* Do they offer any warranties or guarantees for their work?
* Can they provide a rough estimate of the cost for the services you need?
* Do they have any experience with your specific type of guitar (e.g., acoustic, electric, bass)?

By asking these questions, you'll get a better sense of their expertise, pricing, and customer service. It's also a good idea to ask if they have any availability before the festival, so you can plan accordingly.

Give them a call, and I hope you get your guitar serviced and sounding great for the festival!
